intro: Laseguea emarginata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It typically grows in moist, rocky soils at high elevations, often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. The plant features slender, upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that have a distinctive notched or scalloped edge. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, arranged in spikes, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Laseguea emarginata is part of the Ranunculaceae family and is known for its ornamental value as well as its ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
